Each layer is separated by wire mesh.\n2) Charcoal filter: Charcoal filter can be made on site or in a drum. Pebbles, gravel and sand are filled in the drum or chamber. Each layer should be separated by wire mesh. Thin layer of charcoal is used to absorb odour if any.\n3) PVC pipe filter: This filter is made of PVC pipe of 1 to 1.20 m length; Diameter of pipe depends on the area of roof. Six inches dia. pipe is enough for a 1500 Sq. Ft. roof and 8 inches dia. pipe should be used for roofs more than 1500 Sq. Ft. Pipe is divided into three compartments by wire mesh." 1Yes certainly, RWH systems need not necessarily be installed in newly built houses, it can also be installed in houses which are already been built. 1Existing unused structures like dried open wells, sumps etc can be used for RWH as also defunct borewells, instead of constructing recharge structures. This will also reduce the total cost. 1"Underground and cellar tanks have to be fitted with an overflow through which the water can flow into the sewage system or an infiltration system. If connected to the sewage system, the overflow should be above the system's backed-up water level. If necessary, a backpressure flap should be installed. Above-ground tanks should always be connected to a downpipe filter. This will prevent the water from flowing inward when the rainwater tank is full and instead it will flow through the downpipe into the sewer." 1An underground tank is ideal for storing rainwater because the soil protects the tank from light and heat. Algae and microorganisms cannot form due to the darkness and temperature, ensuring consistent water quality. You should also ensure that an above-ground rainwater tank is as opaque as possible (Not transparent or translucent or impenetrable to light). To avoid the water warming up too much, it should installed out of direct sunlight. 1What is termite (white ants) ? 1How will I know my premise is infested by termites ? 1What are the control measures or solutions for this ? 1How is this treatment done ? 1For the under construction buildings, is there any disturbance in the process of construction ? 1 For an existing building, is there any damage to the walls / structure 1I have to vacate the premises at the time of treatment ? 1Is there any warranty for this treatment ? 1How much does it cost ? 1Termites (sub terranean) are social insects and live in colonies below ground. The worker termites enter our structure through a gap (0.5 mm gap is sufficient for them) in search of food (cellulosic material). Material containing cellulose like wood (furniture) , paper & cloth is attacked by them. 1Signs of termite infestation – a) Mud tube on wall, ceiling and furniture ; b) Damaged wooden furniture and fixtures ; c) scattered wings of alates / swammers ; d) Termite mound in the surrounding of the structure ; d) mud shelter on the trunk of the trees, dry patches of grass in lawn, surrounding the structure 1The Principle of the treatment is " To create a continuous chemical barrier / zone in between the ground and the structure so the ground nesting termites will not attack the structure ". 1There are 2 said treatments. Pre construction anti termite treatment - This treatment is ideal for the underconstruction buildings in its early stages. In this the chemical barrier / zone is created in the soil at plinth level and this treatment is called "Pre-construction Anti-termite Treatment". And post construction anti termite treatment when the building structure is ready/existing and infested with termites, this is done by drilling at the wall and floor junction / skirting level and creating the chemical barrier / zone at the bottom of the walls, this treatment is called "Post-construction Anti-termite Treatment".
1No. This is done simultaneously with your construction work before plinth PCC. 1No. The service provider will drill 12 mm dia holes @ 300 mm apart at skirting level. The infants, aged persons or any allergic person should not be present at the time of treatment. And after the treatment you can stay immediately in the premises after cleaning. 1Yes. It varies from 1 to 10 years on the type of treatment, type of structure / building / premises, level of infestation etc. You can get more information from our service delivery partner after raising a service request. 1The charges will be decided after the inspection of the site and it depends on type of treatment, feasibility of treatment, internal furnitures & fixtures, level of infestation, travel cost, time required for treatment etc. 1Your current language is 1UPDATE LANGUAGE 1Go to My Projects

1What is a 2D Layout service? 1What is a 2D plan service? 1A 2D Layout is the two dimensional layout of a house as seen from above. A 2D Layout is used by home building experts to design and construct the house. A 2D Layout request via the Utec App entails requesting for a professional 2D Layout to be made as per your home building requirement. 1A 2D plan is a two dimensional layout of a house as seen from above. It is used by homebuilding experts to design and construct the house. A 2D plan request via the Utec App allows you to request for a professional 2D plan to be made as per your specific homebuilding requirements. 1What is the process after raising a request? 1After the Service request is raised on Utec, our Executive will call you to confirm the request and setup an appointment for collection of additional data. The Utec expert will call you as per the appointment scheduled by you, to collect relevant data to commence the designing process. 1Can I ask for changes in my delivery? 1Can I make changes in the 2D plan? 1For 2D Layout delivered by Utec, you can avail upto 2 reworks. In order to make changes to your selected plan, please call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823. They will assist you to book an appointment with the Utec Experts to collect the data for changes.
1What is a 3D Elevation service? 1What is a 3D plan service? 1A 3D Elevation service on Utec helps you to request for the three dimensional elevation views of your home. All you need to do to raise the service request, is provide us your details and upload the 2D of your home. 13D Elevation service provides 3D designs that are made by experts as per your requirement & budget. 1How do I request a 3D Elevation service? 1How do I avail a 3D plan service? 1You can raise a 3D Elevation service request by clicking on Request Service button below and filling up the mandatory details about your plot. Please upload the 2D Layout of your home and submit to raise the service request. 1You can request for a 3D Elevation by visiting the the home page of the App. Select "3D Elevation", click on the "Request Service" button, fill up the mandatory details about your plot and continue to raise the service request. 1What is the next step after a request for 3D Elevation is made ? 1After the service is requested on Utec, our executive will call you to confirm the request and set up an appointment for collection of detailed data .The Utec expert will then call you as per the appointment scheduled, to collect relevant data to start the designing process. 1After the service is requested on Utec, our executive will call you to confirm the request and set up an appointment for collection of detailed data .The Utec expert will then call you as per the appointment scheduled, to collect relevant data to start the designing process.

All you have to do is raise a service request with your details, such as plot details and 3D. 1How can I get the VR Experience? 1You can schedule VR service delivery from the available locations with your preferences for date and the time slot. Our Customer Care Team will call you to confirm the appointment or call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823 to schedule the appointment yourself. 1How can I change my slot of VR Experience? 1Please call our Customer Care Team on our toll free number 1800 266 8823

1How do I avail the service? 1You can avail this service by raising a service request in Rain water harvesting tab on the Utec Platform. 1What will the process be? 1After the Service request is raised on Utec, our Executive will call you to confirm the request and to collect additional information, if any. Post this, the Service request is passed on to our service delivery partner who will get in touch with you for the service delivery. 1What will all will be covered in installation? 1The water outlets from your rooftop would be connected together through PVC pipes which will further be connected to a filter. The filter\'s outlet would be connected to the borewell / Underground water tank (whichever provision you have in your plot for Rainwater Harvesting as a pre-requisite) 1What is Rain Water Harvesting? 1Rain Water Harvesting is the technique to store and conserve rain water for future use through installation of a filter system in a collection tank / borewell at home. The installation planning of Rain water harvesting system should ideally be done during house design stage. Utec offers this service to you, through our third party partners at a cost. 1Where can I raise a Service Request for Rain Water Harvesting? Is my addresses servicable? 1Service Requests can be raised on the Utec & Utec Partner Apps. Service is scheduled based on the serviceability of our partners & availability of their experts in your area / location. You will be notified about the serviceability in your location at the time of raising service request on the App. 1Who can request for Rainwater Harvesting System on Utec? 1Home Builders & Partners registered on Utec Platform can request and avail this service 1Is this is a paid service? 1Rain Water Harvesting is a paid service. Payment is to be made directly to our partner assigned for service delivery. No payment is to be done to Utec. 1Is the Rain Water Harvesting system installation dependent on any existing or planned changes to the house? 11. If you are planning to store the rainwater for daily usage, then you need to have an underground concrete tank as collection point.\n2. The slope of the rooftop and the water outlets direction should be towards borewell/Underground water tank so as to reduce the material requirement and hence costs during the final installation 1Which is the preferred process for rainwater harvesting? 1There are two types of processes for Rain Water Harvesting: Filter Process and Soak Pit System. Filter process is recommended for normal roof size(upto 3000 sqft). Soak pit system only for bigger Roof sizes(>3000 sqft) and industrial use 1How much rainwater can I conserve from my roof area? 1Approx 1 lac litre per annum can be harvested with 1000 sq ft roof size with rain fall of 38 inch(~96cm). 1What kind of maintenance would the installed Rain Water Harvesting system require? 1The installed system is nearly maintenance free and durable. It will need only annual cleaning by the local plumber. 1What will be the final cost for Rain Water Harvesting System and who will provide it? 1You will receive the installation & design related inputs along with the final cost of installation on WhatsApp from our Service Delivery Partner in 48 hours after the site visit. 1How much time is required for the installation? 1Post your confirmation and advance payment transfer to our service partner. It will take maximum 7 working days to install the equipment. 1Is there any government waiver or discount offering for Rain Water Harvesting system installation? 1Yes. There are provisions by local state government and Municipal Corporation for a waiver (6% to 20%) in Property Tax or water bill (it applies in some places**)for confirming Rain Water Harvesting System installed with Certified by the installing Party/Vendor. 1Is the Rain Water Harvesting system covered under any warranty by the service delivery partner?
1Rain Water harvesting system installed by our service partner covers 1 year full warranty for any mechanical fault in the system. With 1st year free AMC. ( post it will be chargeable agreed between both parties). Customers should safely store the warranty and AMC documents with them for any future needs. 1What\'s the durability of complete system? 1Entire system can be used at full capacity for up to 20 years if cleaning process is done at advised intervals. 1What are the different types of filters available? 1There are generally 3 types of filters depending on area and water quality\n1) Sand filter: These are constructed by brick masonry and filled by pebbles, gravel, and sand. Each layer is separated by wire mesh.\n2) Charcoal filter: Charcoal filter can be made on site or in a drum. Pebbles, gravel and sand are filled in the drum or chamber. Each layer should be separated by wire mesh. Thin layer of charcoal is used to absorb odour if any.\n3) PVC pipe filter: This filter is made of PVC pipe of 1 to 1.20 m length; Diameter of pipe depends on the area of roof. Six inches dia. pipe is enough for a 1500 Sq. Ft. roof and 8 inches dia. pipe should be used for roofs more than 1500 Sq. Ft. Pipe is divided into three compartments by wire mesh. 1Is it possible to install a Rain Water Harvesting system in a constructed home? 1Yes. Rain Water Harvesting systems need not necessarily be installed in newly built houses. They can also be installed in houses which are already been built. 1Can existing storage structures/unused water sources be used for RWH? 1Instead of constructing recharge structures, existing unused water sources like dried open wells, sumps, defunct borewells, etc can be used for Rain Water Harvesting. 1What happens when the rainwater tank is full? 1Underground and cellar tanks have to be fitted with an overflow through which the water can flow into the sewage system or an infiltration system. If connected to the sewage system, the overflow should be above the system\'s backed-up water level. If necessary, a backpressure flap should be installed. Above-ground tanks should always be connected to a downpipe filter. This will prevent the water from flowing inward when the rainwater tank is full and instead it will flow through the downpipe into the sewer. 1Does the rainwater collected in the rainwater tank remains fresh? 1An underground tank is ideal for storing rainwater because the soil protects the tank from light and heat. Algae and microorganisms cannot form due to exposure to sunlight and temperature, ensuring consistent water quality. If you have an above-ground rainwater tank, you must ensure that it is as opaque as possible (Not transparent or translucent) and it should installed away from direct sunlight, to prevent water from warming. 1What is not covered in the rainwater harvesting service? 1The installation of Underground water tank or borewell would not be done by the service provider under Rainwater Harvesting Service.
1Did you know? 1Pre-construction \ntermite control has \nhigher effectiveness \nthan post-construction \ntreatment 1Pre-construction \ntermite treatment can \nhelp protect not just the \ninterior but also the \nexterior and the \nlandscaping 1Termites can travel \nupwards multiple \nstoreys of the \nconstruction. 1Not just old homes, \neven new homes are \nat risk of termite \ninfestation
1How do I avail the service? 1You can avail of this service by raising a service request in the Anti-Termite Treatment tab on the Utec Platform. 1What will the process be? 1After the request is raised, our executive will call you to confirm the request and to collect additional information, if any. Post this, the details of Service request are passed on to our service delivery partner who will get in touch with you for the service delivery. 1Is there a warranty on the service? 1The Pre-construction termite treatment done at foundation level comes with a warranty of 10 years. For the warranty to be valid, the treatment must be completely administered as per the process suggested by our Service Partner. You can get more information from our termite treatment delivery partner after raising a service request. 1What is termite (white ants, दीमक) ? 1Subterranean Termites are social insects and live in colonies below ground. They are considered pests because termites enter the house structure through a gap (0.5 mm gap is sufficient) in search of food. Food for termites is household material containing cellulose like wood, wooden furniture, paper and cloth. 1How do termites enter the house? 1Termites need moisture to survive and spread underground. They usually enter a house from the soil through its foundation or through cracks in the slab, expansion joints, voids in brick and around plumbing. Wood structures in direct contact with the ground are also easy access routes for termites. 1Can termites enter concrete? 1Termites cannot pass through solid concrete, but they can get through a crack only 1/32nd of an inch wide. Openings this size or bigger often occur where two pieces of concrete abut – like when poured separately – and around plumbing penetrations through the concrete or where the concrete has cracked. 1How they harm the house structure? 1Termites can hollow out the wood in the structure of your house. They can also damage the inside of the walls, areas around your windows and doors and the wood furniture inside your home. 1How to identify termite infestation? 1Signs of termite infestation –\na. Mud tube on wall, ceiling and furniture;\nb. Damaged wooden furniture and fixtures;\nc. Scattered wings of alates / swarmers;\nd. Termite mound in the surrounding of the structure;\ne. Mud shelter on the trunk of the trees, dry patches of grass in lawn, surrounding the structure 1What is Pre-Construction Termite treatment? 1Pre-Construction termite treatment done to prevent termite infestation in new construction. As a part of the treatment, the layer of soil beneath a planned home is treated with termiticide to offer proactive protection. A pre-foundation termite treatment helps in ridding the soil of termites and creating a long term termite barrier for durability of the structure. 1Who can raise the termite treatment request? 1Home Builders & Partners registered on Utec Platform can request and avail this service 1Is this is a paid service? 1Termite Treatment is a paid service. Payment is to be made directly to our partner assigned for service delivery. No payment is to be done to Utec. 1What will the treatment at my site entail? 1Pre Construction: During the plinth level, the soil of the whole plinth level will be treated with the chemicals to create a chemical barrier for the termites.\nPost Construction: To provide the treatment, the service provider will drill 12 mm dia holes about 300 mm apart at skirting level. After the treatment, these holes will be sealed with white cement and we will try to match the colour of the wall to have minimum decor disturbance. 1How does the treatment work? 1The Principle of the treatment is "To create a continuous chemical barrier/zone between the ground and the structure so the ground nesting termites will not attack the structure". 1How many types of termite control treatments are available?
1There are 2 said treatments. Pre construction anti termite treatment - This treatment is ideal for the underconstruction buildings in its early stages. In this the chemical barrier / zone is created in the soil at plinth level and this treatment is called "Pre-construction Anti-termite Treatment". And post construction anti termite treatment when the building structure is ready/existing and infested with termites, this is done by drilling at the wall and floor junction / skirting level and creating the chemical barrier / zone at the bottom of the walls, this treatment is called "Post-construction Anti-termite Treatment". 1For the under construction buildings, does termite treatment cause any disturbance in the process of construction? 1The pre-termite foundation treatment is done simultaneously with your construction work before Plinth PCC (Plain Cement Concrete) and does not affect the process of construction. 1For an existing building, does termite treatment cause any damage to the structure? 1This treatments causes no damage to the structure. To provide the treatment, the service provider will drill 12 mm dia holes about 300 mm apart at skirting level. After the treatment, these holes will be sealed with white cement and we will try to match the colour of the wall to have minimum decor disturbance. 1Do the premises have to be vacated at the time of treatment for existing building (post construction treatment)? 1No. You can also see the treatment done. The only precaution is to wear a face mask & to not touch the chemically treated surfaces. Infants, aged persons or any allergic person should not be present at the time of treatment. Post the treatment, you can stay in the premises immediately after cleaning. 1Is there any warranty for Post Construction termite treatment? 1For the post construction treatment, there is a warranty of 5 years, if done for the entire home / building. In case a specific floor of a building needs to be treated, a 1 year warranty would apply. For the warranty to be valid, the treatment must be completely administered as per the process suggested by our Service Partner. You can get more information from our termite treatment delivery partner after raising a service request. 1How much does termite treatment cost? 1Termite treatment charges can be quoted after the inspection of the site. Charges are dependent on the level of infestation, type of treatment, feasibility of treatment, internal furnitures & fixtures, travel cost and time required for treatment. The service delivery partner will share a detailed estimate of cost post inspection. 1How much time does the treatment take? 1The treatment takes 1 day of time 1Is the site visit paid or free? 1Site Inspection is free, but if the location is far away, then logistics costs may be charged which would get adjusted in the final invoice. 1What is covered in the termite treatment service? 1Sub-terranean termites (ground nesting termites) are only covered in the anti-termite treatment. Since these are the ground nesting termites which grow and travel through the soil, hence the treatment of creating a chemical barrier around the house stops these termites from infesting the house. 1What is not covered in the termite treatment service? 1Dry-wood termites infestation, which are usually experienced in the coastal regions are not covered under the treatment. Since, these termites are wood nesting termites, they grow inside the wood hence the chemical barrier at foundation level doesn\'t affect them. 1For Pre-Construction treatment, do I need to repeat the treatment after the warranty period? 1Once the treatment is done, if the created chemical barrier is disturbed somehow, then we need to re-do the treatment and it will charge extra to the customer. Otherwise, the treatment doesn\'t need to be re-done even after the warranty period is over. 1For post construction treatment, do I need to repeat the treatment after the warranty period? 1After the expiry of the warranty period, customer needs to re-do the post- construction Anti-termite treatment.

1What is a 2D Layout service? 1What is a 2D plan service? 1A 2D Layout is the two dimensional layout of a house as seen from above. A 2D is used by home building experts to design and construct the house. A 2D request via the Utec App entails requesting for a professional 2D to be made as per your home building requirement. 1A 2D plan is a two dimensional layout of a house as seen from above. It is used by homebuilding experts to design and construct the house. A 2D plan request via the Utec App allows you to request for a professional 2D plan to be made as per your specific homebuilding requirements. 1How do I avail a 2D Layout service? 1How do I avail a 2D plan service? 1You can raise a 2D service request by visiting the Plans section on the Home Page. Select the "Get a layout " option, fill up the basic details about your plot and submit to raise the service request. 1To raise a request for a 2D plan go to the 2D Plans section on the homepage and click on "Request a 2D Plan". Then, fill up the basic details 1What is the process after raising the 2D Service request? 1What happens after I raise a 2D plan service request? 1After the Service request is raised on Utec, our Executive will call you to confirm the request and setup an appointment for collection of additional data. The Utec expert will call you as per the appointment scheduled by you, to collect relevant data to commence the designing process. 1After you raise the service request on the Utec App, our executive will call you to confirm the request and set up an appointment for any extra details that our design team might need. Once we have all the details, we will begin the 2D design. 1What will be delivered as part of 2D Service? 1What will be delivered as part of the 2D plan service? 1You will be receive 1 layout of 2D along with furniture layouts of all floors. 1You will receive one 2D layout of your home, including the furniture layout on all the floors. 1Will it be possible to make changes in the 2D? 1For 2Ds delivered by Utec, you can avail upto 3 reworks. In order to make changes to your selected plan, please call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823 . They will assist you to book an appointment with the Utec Experts to collect the data for changes. 1For all Utec 2D plans, you can avail up to 3 requests for change. To request a change, you will need to call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823. They will help you to book an appointment with an Utec expert who will connect with you to collect the details for the change you need. 1What is the cost of availing a 2D Service? 1What is the cost of availing a 2D plan service? 1Currently you can avail the 2D service free of cost. 1This service is free of cost.
1What is a 3D Elevation service? 1What is a 3D plan service? 1A 3D Elevation service on Utec helps you to request for the three dimensional elevation views of your home. All you need to do to raise the service request, is provide us your details and upload the 2D of your home. 1The 3D plan service on the Utec App helps you to request for the three dimensional layout views of your new home. All you need to do to raise the service request, provide us with your details and upload the 2D plan of your home. 1How do I avail a 3D Elevation Service? 1How do I avail a 3D plan service? 1You can raise a 3D Elevation service request by visiting the Plans section on the Home Page. Select the "Get a 3D Plan" option, fill up the mandatory details about your plot, upload the 2D of your home and submit to raise the service request. 1To raise a request for a 3D plan go to the 3D Plans section on the homepage and click on "Request a 3D Plan". Then, fill up the basic details about your plot, upload the 2D layout of your home as asked and submit. Once we receive your request, we will get in touch with you to process it. 1What is the process after raising the 3D Elevation service request? 1What happens after I raise a 3D plan service request? 1After the Service request is raised on Utec, our Executive will call you to confirm the request and setup an appointment for collection of additional data. The Utec expert will call you as per the appointment scheduled by you, to collect relevant data and commence the designing process. 1After you raise the service request on the Utec App, our executive will call you to confirm the request and set up an appointment for any extra details that our design team might need. Once we have all the details, we will begin the 3D design. 1What will be delivered as part of 3D Elevation service? 1What will be delivered as part of 3D Elevation service? 1You will receive two (2) Elevation views along with rendered views of all four sides of your home. 1You will receive 2 3D views of your new home based on your 2D plan along with rendered views of all the four sides of the structure. 1Will it be possible to make changes in the 3D Elevation? 1Can I make changes in the 3D plan? 1For 3D Elevations delivered by Utec, you can avail upto 2 reworks. In order to make changes to your selected elevation, please call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823 . They will assist you to book an appointment with the Utec Experts to collect the data for changes. 1For all Utec 3D plans, you can avail up to 2 requests for change. To request a change, you will need to call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823. They will help you to book an appointment with an Utec expert who will connect with you to collect the details for the change you need. 1What is the cost of availing a 3D Service? 1What is the cost of availing a 3D Service? 1The cost of Utec 3D Elevation Service depends on the plot context like size of plot, number of floors, etc. After filling in the necessary data, the service cost will be calculated. 1The cost of an Utec 3D plan depends on project details including size of plot, number of floors, etc. After filling in the necessary details, the service cost will be calculated. 1What is a rough sketch and why is it required? 1What is a rough sketch and why is it required? 1A Rough Sketch is a home design idea drawn roughly with some indicators of size/area/dimensions. It helps us understand your requirement / plot context better before we start designing. To share the rough sketch, you can take a picture of the sketch which has all lines and specifications visible clearly and upload It on Utec app. 1A rough sketch is a home design idea drawn roughly with some indicators of size/area/dimensions. It helps us understand your requirements a bit better before we start designing. To share the rough sketch, you can take a picture of the sketch which has all lines and specifications visible clearly and upload it on the Utec App. 1In which all formats can I upload my Rough Sketch? 1What formats can I use to upload my rough sketch? 1You can upload any type of images (PNG, JPEG, GPG, etc.) also you can upload documents like PDF, etc.If you need any help in uploading files or file related issues, please call our Customer Care Team on 1800 266 8823. 1Rough sketches can be uploaded in formats including PNG, JPEG and GPG. You can also upload PDF documents. If you need any help in uploading files or file-related issues, please call our Customer Care at 1800 266 8823. 1What if I do not have a Rough Sketch for 2D? 1It is not mandatory to provide a rough sketch for 2D. However it helps us understand your requirements/plot context better. 1What if I do not know the Plot Area? 1What if I do not know the plot area? 1Please ask an expert to measure your plot area. It can be submitted in square feet, square yards, Gunthas etc. 1Please ask an expert to measure your plot area. It can be submitted in square feet, square yards, Gunthas etc. 1What if I do not have the site pictures right now? 1What if I do not have the site pictures right now? 1You can upload site pictures as and when you receive them. 1You can upload site pictures as and when you receive them. 1What if I do not have the exact address right now? 1What if I do not have the exact address right now? 1In case you do not have the exact site address with you, you can enter your pin code in the map or nearest landmark with your location. 1In case you do not have the exact site address with you, you can enter your pin code in the map or nearest landmark with your location. 1How will I know if my request for 3D elevation is submitted? 1How will I know if my request for 3D plan is submitted? 1You will receive a notification saying 3D Request sent successfully. 1You will receive a notification saying 3D plan request sent successfully. 1Where will I get notifications regarding my request? 1Where will I get notifications regarding my request? 1You will receive notifications on Utec app as well as via SMS/Email/WhatsApp. Click on the bell icon on the Utec Home Page to view the past notifications. 1You will receive notifications on the Utec App as well as via SMS/Email/WhatsApp. Click on the bell icon on the the Utec homepage to view the past notifications.
1What is VR? 1Virtual Reality (VR) is a service that helps you experience the three dimensional view of your house in an interactive manner. Utec offers the VR service on charge basis. All you have to do is raise a service request with your details, such as plot details and 3D. 1What does Select a plan for the VR experience mean? 1You may select one plan out of 3D Elevation views delivered, for the final VR experience. 1What is the cost of availing the VR Service? 1The cost of Utec VR Experience depends on the plot context like size of plot, number of floors, etc. After filling in the necessary data, the service cost will be calculated. 1What does Add to Archivesmean? 1As a part of Layout Plan service, Utec provides more than one house plan. Please go through the plans and finally select the plan you want to proceed with for either 3D or for making changes. The remaining plans not selected by you, can be accessed through Archives. 1How can I access my Archives folder later? 1In order to access your Archives, please go to your service request output from My Projects of Utec app. Click on the Options menu, and then click on Archives to view the archived plans. 1How can I avail a VR Experience if I choose an existing design on the platform? 1Please raise a service request for VR walkthrough in the Plans section on Utec App. Mention the design name that you liked along with the mandatory details. Our Customer Care Team will then update you on the time it will take to build the VR experience for you. 1How can I change my slot of VR Experience? 1Please call our Customer Care Team on our toll free number 1800 266 8823 1Is it possible to make some changes in the house layout after VR Experience? Can I resubmit the Layout /3D elevation? 1Changes in the layout plan post the delivery of a 3D elevation or a VR Experience are not possible. Changes are possible in the 2D and 3D Elevation stage before finalisation of each plan. You may raise a new request for an updated plan along with the required changes. 1How can I schedule a visit for the VR Experience? 1You can schedule a VR walkthrough delivery from the available locations with your preferences for date and the time slot. Our Customer Care Team will call you to confirm the appointment or call our Customer Care on 1800 266 8823 to schedule the appointment yourself. 1What should I be aware of, before requesting for VR walkthrough service? 1You can request for VR Experience only once the 3D elevation is finalised - VR Experience cannot be requested for, without a 3D Elevation. Do call our Customer Care Team on 1800 266 8823 for more details. 1What are the requirements to raise the 3D request? 1What are the requirements to raise a 3D plan request? 1To raise a 3D request, you need to upload a Layout plan, created by an Expert and finalised by you. Along with it, you need to provide your colour preferences, budget preferences, any special requirements or reference pictures that you want to share with our team.

You’ll get a call from our Expert to ensure that you get the perfect 3D elevation for your home. 1Car 1Bike 1Share preferences 1Clear all 1Type of persona 1Years of experience 1Type of projects 1Price 1Select Add - Ons 1Add-ons 1Select Partner 1Sort 1Relevance 1Price: Low to High 1Price: High to Low 1Distance 1Remove Partner 1Get an immersive VR experience to visualise how your home will look from the outside and inside before it is built 15 Working Days (After your requirements are submitted and verified) 1See different spaces in your home as per your design 1Ensure adequate light and ventilation for your home 1Understand exact room sizes and placement 1Imagine the exteriors and interiors of your home 1Share plot details & final 3D model on App 1Share detailed requirements on call with our \n expert 1Get VR experience within 5 working days after you have submitted all details accurately and the same have been verified by our design experts. 1What is a VR experience? 1A VR or a Virtual Reality experience helps you \'see\' or visualize your new home - each of its spaces, every nook and corner, inside and outside, including how the furniture will be placed - before it is built. 1What is the cost of a VR service? 1The cost of a Utec VR Service is calculated on the basis of the plot details, including the total area and the number of floors. 1How can I change the time slot of my VR Service? 1Please call our customer care team toll free on 18002668823 to reschedule your VR Service appointment. 1Is it possible to make some changes in the house plan/layout/ design after the VR Service experience? Can I resubmit the layout /3D Design? 1Changes in the 2D Layout or 3D Elevation after the delivery of a VR Service are not possible. Changes are possible in the 2D Layout and 3D Elevation before finalisation of each design. You may raise a new request for an updated layout/elevation along with the required changes. 1How can I schedule a VR Service? 1You can request for a VR Service from the available locations with your preference for date and the time slot, through the Utec App. Our customer care team will call you to confirm the appointment. You can also call our customer care on 18002668823 to schedule a VR Service appointment. 1Is there anything I specifically need to know before placing a request for a VR Service ? 1You can request a VR Service only after the 3D Layout & model has been finalized. A VR Service is based on a final 3D Layout of the home.

2Write a feedback 2What is Permissible Floor\nArea Ratio?
2What are setbacks? 2What is Ground Coverage Ratio? 2Floor Area Ratio helps you understand the total buildable area in your plot. It helps you understand maximum area you can build on your plot either in a single floor or multiple floors.
2While constructing a house it is important to leave open spaces on all 4 sides, these are called as Setbacks.\nSetbacks are usually provided for proper lighting, ventilation and fire escape provisions.
2Ground Coverage helps you understand the total floor area you can consider while building your house on your plot.\nIt is usually measured in percentage, It is a ratio of overall floor area in your building that you can construct on your overall plot area.

Get a Vaastu compliant layout plan from us today! 2Sleeping direction: It is favorable for adults to keep their heads towards the southern and eastern directions while sleeping.\n\nPlacement of bed: It would be best to place the bed along the southern or western walls. If this is not possible, the bed should be as far as possible from the eastern and northern walls.\n\nWardrobes and heavy furniture should be along the South and West wall.\n\nConstruction material for bed: Use wood material for the construction of the bed. It would help if you avoided wrought iron beds.\n\nPlacement of mirror/T.V.s: Do not place mirrors or television sets in front of the bed.\n\nDoor position: Do not place the bed in front of the bedroom door.\n\nThe shape of bed: One should avoid irregular shaped beds. The shape of the bed should always be regular.\n\nDo not use single bed mattresses for double beds.\n\nColors Scheme: For bedrooms in the southwest direction of the home, the recommended color scheme is pink, light green, or light blue. 2Bed positions: The bed position should be in the southwestern corner of a boy\'s room and the northwestern corner of a girl\'s room.\n\nSleeping direction: While sleeping, the child\'s head should be facing east. It benefits their peace of mind and ensures enlightenment.\n\nDoor position: The door of the children\'s room should not directly face the bed.\n\nFurniture position: The southwest direction is best for placing furniture while avoiding any furnishing in the middle or center of the room, which creates an obstruction. Keep all the furnishing 3 inches away from the wall. Place the cabinets and closets in the south or west direction.\n\nComputer position: Avoid placing T.V., computer/laptop in the children\'s room as they affect child concentration. However, considering modern compulsions, you can place computers in the north and Television in the southeast.\n\nMirror position: Avoid any exposed mirrors in the children\'s room and not place any mirror in front of the bed.\n\nStudy table orientation: Face in the eastern, northern, or northeastern direction while studying. Study areas should be clutter-free to boost concentration, and a clutter-free ambiance is suitable for generating new ideas.\n\nPosition of light: Bright lights should be placed in the Southeast direction while avoiding sharp lamps on the study table, which begets strain.\n\nColor scheme: To add freshness to your child\'s mood, brush up his room with a Green or Blue hue.\n\nDoor position: Doors in the children\'s room are best in the East or North. 2Drained water pipe position: You should provide fitting of pipes for drained water in the northeast. The bathroom floor slope should be towards north and east, so water drains to the northeast side of the bathroom.\n\nShower, taps, and mirror position: Shower and fixtures in the bathroom can be attached to the northern wall.\n\nGeyser position: You can place the geyser in the southeast corner.\n\nBathtub & Washbasin position: You can place the bathtub in the western corner and provide space for a washbasin in the northeastern corner.\n\nOverhead tank position: The Overhead tanks should be in the southwest part of the site.\n\nWindow/ ventilator position: There should be windows or ventilators in the east or the north.\n\nShowerhead/ bath position: You can take a bath in the western position of bathroom\n\nBathrooms without W.C./ commode: You can place bathrooms without attached Toilet in the east or between east and north-east of your home.\n\nW.C./ Commode position and orientation: If there is an attached toilet in the bathroom itself, W.C. should be on the West, South, or Northwest side and a few inches above the ground. W.C. should always be on the north-south axis and never on the east-west axis.\n\nColor scheme: It is advisable to choose bright and soothing colors for bathroom walls. Ideal Colours: White, Grey or Pink\n\nMirror position: You can place the mirror on the eastern and northern walls of your bathroom.\n\nDirty linens position: It would help if you placed the dirty linens on the west side of the bathroom as setting rays are very harmful to bacteria and kill them.\n\nCabinet position: If there is a cabinet, it should always be on the southwest side of the bathroom + Toilet.\n\nToilet position: Keep Toilet locations at a safe distance from the kitchen and the dining room.\n\nDoor position: Place the door of the Toilet on the eastern side.\n\nSeptic Tank position: Avoid building a septic tank on the Southern side.\n\nWashing machine position: The appropriate directions for keeping the washing machine are southeast and northwest. 2Dining table position: Keep some distance between the dining table and adjacent walls.\n\nFridge position: If you want to place a fridge in the dining room, it should be in the southeast direction.\n\nWashbasin position: The wash basin should be on the northeast side of the room.\n\nKeep distance from Toilet:The dining area should not be adjacent to the Toilet.\n\nNo connection to Pooja/ Toilet rooms: The pooja room/ toilet door should not open in front of the dining area. 2Furniture position: It is advisable to place the furniture in the west or south direction. Furniture such as showcases or heavy articles should be in the south or west direction. It should be rectangular or square, not in an oval, circular or odd shape.\n\nT.V. position: You can place T.V. in the southeast direction.\n\nCooler/ A.C. position: You can place the cooler or A.C in the west or north direction.\n\nTelephone position: You can place the telephones in the east, north, or southeast direction.\n\nFishpot position: Aquariums are beneficial to place in the north, east, and northeast of the living room.\n\nArt/ Picture Frames position: The usage of painting can create a pleasant environment in the room. Picture of waterfalls; the rising sun provides positive energy. Avoid images that symbolize death, violence, and negative aspects of life.\n\nColor scheme: The color of the wall in the living room should be white, yellow, blue, or green. Choose light colors over dark colors. Avoid black and red colors in the living room. 2Cooking gas position and orientation: You can place the cooking gas in the southeast direction. The cook should face east while cooking.\n\nSink position: Place a water sink in the northeast with the maximum distance from cooking gas.\n\nWindows & ventilator position: More oversized windows in the kitchen should be on the eastern side while using small ventilators for the southern direction.\n\nTaps and water storage: Provide fixtures and water storage in the northeast corner of the kitchen.\n\nMicrowave position: It would help if you placed electronic equipment like a microwave, oven, or refrigerator in the west or south side of the kitchen.\n\nThe slope of the floor: The slope of water flow should be from the southwest towards the northeast.\n\nGas cylinder position: You can place the gas cylinder in the southeast corner.\n\nGeyser location: Install the geyser on the southeast corner.\n\nFood storage location: Storage for all the utensils, food grains, and the overhead almirah should be on the southern and western walls and not on the northern and the eastern walls.\n\nRefrigerator/ Dishwasher location: Place the fridge in the southwest corner of the kitchen and a dishwasher in the northeast of the kitchen.\n\nExhaust fan: Install the exhaust fan either in the northwest corner of the south wall.\n\nConnection to the bathroom/ toilet: There should be no toilets or bathrooms above or below or adjoining the kitchen.The door of the kitchen should never face the door of the Toilet. 2Color scheme: You can use tints of white, yellow or blue in the storerooms.\n\nFood storage by usage location: Store annual stock of granary in the southwest corner while store daily uses grains in the northwest direction.\n\nOil, ghee, and cylinder location: Combustible material like oil, ghee, refined and gas cylinders, etc., should be stored in the southeast corner of storage.\n\n 2Worshipping orientation: It would be best if you faced east/north while worshiping and never towards the south.\n\nOrientation of deities: Deity should never face south.\n\nColor scheme: The color of the pooja room walls should be white, light blue, lemon, and white marble.\n\nDoor/ window position: The worship room should have doors or windows in the north or the east.\n\nFirepit/ agnikund position: The Firepit/ agnikund should be in the southeast direction of the worship room. It would help if you made the sacred offerings to the fire with the face towards the east.\n\nLampstand position: Lampstands should be placed in the southeast corner of the pooja room. 2Swing set orientation: Place a swing set on the east-west axis. In this way, the person enjoying the swing faces either north or south, and the sun will not hit them in the face directly.\n\nPlant selection: Keep only small flower pots on the Balcony. Flower pots with creepers should not be kept on the Balcony. Giant flower pots and pots with overflowing creepers tend to obstruct light into the Balcony.\n\nPlant position: You can place small plants in the northeast corner of the Balcony. Plants need sunlight to thrive and should be placed in the northeast. There is constant morning sunlight. However, when they grow too tall or grow up a pillar, they will obstruct the light into the Balcony and should be kept short.\n\nRoof material: Avoid using asbestos or tin roofs for a balcony. A tin or asbestos roof absorbs and traps heat within a space, making it uncomfortably hot for the users. 2Staircase location: The staircase should be on the southern side, southwest corner or western side. The staircase should not be in the northeast corner at all.\n\nOrientation of staircase: The steps should lead one from north to south and south to west, and after reaching the mid landing, a staircase can take any direction. Movement on the staircase from the ground to the first floor should be as far as possible in a clockwise direction.\n\nThe number of risers in staircases: The number of risers (vertical surface of stair) in a staircase should be odd, i.e. 17, 19, 21, etc. Similarly, the number of risers in the steps to the house entrance should be odd, i.e. 1, 3, 5 etc. 2Window position: A utility room\'s windows should be designed either in the East or West.\n\nColor scheme: Choose a White, Blue, or Yellow colour for the utility room as they make the space look capacious and release positive vibes.\n\nTry to have a water-storing facility in the utility room. It might help in regions facing water shortage. 2Parking location: The best place to park is the northwest zone. If there is no space in the northwest zone, park the car in the southeast zone.\n\nSmaller vehicle location: Use east and north for smaller vehicles. Two-wheelers used daily can be parked in the North-East zone if there is no other space available. However, don\'t park them in extreme corners.\n\nLarger vehicle location: Use south and west for larger vehicles. If you have a porch in the South-West zone of your house, you can park large-sized four-wheelers here. The location is considered lucky and may help you in profits.\n\nVehicle orientation: Never park your vehicle facing south.\n\nEntry to basement parking: If you create a parking space in the basement, ensure that its Entrance is in the north, east, northwest, or northeast direction. 2Favorable locations: The correct location for constructing a drawing room is in the northeast, northwest, and southeast. You can also use the central east, west, north or south facing area to construct the drawing-room.\n\nSofa location: The best place to set the sofa is against the south and west walls. If there is no place on the south and west wall, go for the east side of the walls.\n\nTabletop foundations: A small, wall or tabletop fountain in the north direction made using copper, stone, glass, clay, stainless steel, or a fish aquarium will create a relaxing space and bring peace to the house along with amazing guests and healthy conversations.\n\nA.C. position: The best-suited wall for placing the air conditioner is on the west, as primarily they get heated up during the night.\n\nArt/ Picture position: Paintings on the north wall stimulate the positive aspect of water bodies and depict wealth. While hanging artwork on the east side brings fulfilment in life, thus painting of fruits and flowers is considered. 2Bed position: It would be best to place the bed in the guest room in the Southwest part of the room.\n\nDoor position: The door of the bathroom must not be directly opposite the bed.\n\nCabinet position: The ideal position for fixing the cabinet is on the south or west, or southwest wall.\n\nEntrance position: The Northwest corner is suitable for the guest room entrance.\n\nColor scheme: For a guest room, the best colour options are light shades of green, blue and white. These colours are known for their serenity and provide calm to the body and vision.\n\nArt/ Picture position: Hanging beautiful paintings on the wall, placing a vase in the room is considered charming and makes the room attractive. 2Open space relative to the direction: Keep more open space around the building in the east and north directions than the west and the south directions.\n\nTulsi plant position: There should be a Tulsi Vrindavan in the east or northeast corner (A structure in which the holy basil plant is grown). The height of Tulsi Vrindavan should not be more than the plinth level.\n\nWaterbody position: Swimming tanks, wells, fountains, underground water storage tanks, borings, etc., should be in the northeast, the east, or the north direction.\n\nGarden position: Gardens, decorative plants, lawns, etc., should be in the east or the north. The ornamental plants should not be taller than three feet. A small waterfall of three to four feet should be constructed in the east or the north, leaving the northeast or the northwest corner.\n\nPlay swing position and orientation: Play swings should be in the east or north, and they should be swinging towards the east or west.\n\nBench position & orientation: Benches in the open space in the east and the north direction should be in the west or the south direction, and the person should sit facing towards the east or the north. 2Favorable locations: It is advisable to construct a porch between the east and north directions to increase property value.\n\nPorch should not block sunlight: Early morning sunlight is essential for all living beings; therefore, there should be no obstruction on the Porch to block the sun rays from reaching your home. 2Ideal location: The ideal place for Verandah is in the North or East direction.\n\nHeight of roof and floor: According to Vaastu, a Verandah should be open. But, if there is a need for a roof, it should be constructed with cement, avoiding the use of tin.The floor and roof of the Verandah should always be lower than the floor and ceiling of the main building. A verandah usually is an open space and is prone to direct sunlight and heavy rains. Having a lower floor level and roof height makes it possible to maintain a cooler temperature.\n\nFlowerpot position: We usually place flower pots in our Verandah, and it has been advised to keep them in the North-East direction as we get a good supply of sunlight in this direction, essential for the sustenance of plants and flowers.\n\nA trap in the Verandah should be made for the sole purpose of draining run-off water. It should never be placed in the South-West side of the Verandah.\n\nShape of Verandah: The ideal shape of a Verandah is squares and rectangles.\n\nWater pools or fountains: It is advisable to build water pools or fountains in the Verandah. These fountains should face the North-East because the ruling element of the North-East zone is water. 2Ideal location: An underground water tank should be dug in the northeast direction. Avoid digging on the diagonal connecting northeast and southwest\n\nAvoid any water source/tank towards the northwest or southeast. 2Do not align with the main gate: Aligning the house\'s main gate with the entrance door along the same line is not considered good. It will avoid the direct flow of energy.\n\nAvoid shadows on the main door: You should make sure that no shadow falls on the main door, especially those of trees and buildings.\n\nSize & style of the door: The main Entrance of your house should be larger than any other door of the home. It is advisable to have the main door in two parts instead of just one.\n\nNumber of risers in steps: Make sure that the number of risers in entrance steps is in odd numbers. Also, the main Entrance should be higher than the approach way or pathway.\n\nNameplate: Having a nameplate on the main door or on the compound wall of the house is believed to invite good health, prosperity, and wealth into the home.\n\nDoor material: Avoid metals for the door or even for the frame of the door. 2The central part of a building is termed Brahmasthan and is regarded as a sacred and powerful zone in Vastu.\n\nEnsure you keep the centre of the house clean, calm and clutter-free.\n\nSoft colours such as white, yellow or light green are recommended for adoring the Brahmasthan. 2North is among the most promising directions and is dedicated to Kuber, the God of wealth and prosperity.\n\nThis direction should always be more open, beautiful and allow the entrance of light. and thus, it is the favourable direction for the entrance of the home, porch and verandah 2East is known to be a compelling direction, and it is owned by the Hindu deity, Indra.\n\nAfter north, east is the most favourable direction for openings like doors, windows and ventilation.\n\nIt is a good direction for the home entrance, porch, verandah, bedrooms, living room and kitchen. 2West direction is known for stability in life, and the Hindu deity, Varun, owns it.\n\nIt is not advisable to have larger openings from this direction.\n\nIt is a favourable direction for bedrooms, kitchen and porch.\n\nYou should altogether avoid open spaces and puja room in this direction. 2The owner of the southern direction is a deity called Yam.\n\nThis direction should not have larger openings, and it is advisable to have enclosed spaces or areas with minimum openings here.\n\nIt is also an ideal direction for a master bedroom. 2Kitchens should not be designed on the northeastern side of the house.\n\nBedrooms and bathrooms too need to be avoided in this direction.\n\nIt is recommended to use water features such as a small water fountain in the northeast corner.\n\nIt is a favourable location for puja rooms. 2Openings in the northwest direction are favourable.\n\nIt is advisable to have a children\'s bedroom in this location.\n\nIt is favourable to have the kitchen in this direction.\n\nThis direction is favourable for the entrance of basement parking.\n\nIt is a good location for parking. 2It is favorable for adults to keep their heads towards the southern and eastern directions while sleeping.\n\nSouth eastern location is not favourable for master bedrooms and underground water bodies.\n\nHowever, guest rooms are recommended in this location.\n\nYou can place the cooking gas in the southeast direction. The cook should face east while cooking.\n\nGas cylinders should be kept in this direction. 2Overhead water tanks should be placed in this direction.\n\nIt is recommended to store annual stock of granary in the southwest corner.\n\nBedrooms must be avoided in this direction.\n\nKitchens must not be designed in this direction.\n\nPuja rooms must also be avoided in this direction. 2delivery

2How do I avail the service? 2You can avail this service by raising a service request in Rain water harvesting tab on the Utec Platform. 2What will the process be? 2After the Service request is raised on Utec, our Executive will call you to confirm the request and to collect additional information, if any. Post this, the Service request is passed on to our service delivery partner who will get in touch with you for the service delivery. 2What will all will be covered in installation? 2The water outlets from your rooftop would be connected together through PVC pipes which will further be connected to a filter. The filter\'s outlet would be connected to the borewell / Underground water tank (whichever provision you have in your plot for Rainwater Harvesting as a pre-requisite) 2What is Rain Water Harvesting? 2Rain Water Harvesting is the technique to store and conserve rain water for future use through installation of a filter system in a collection tank / borewell at home. The installation planning of Rain water harvesting system should ideally be done during house design stage. Utec offers this service to you, through our third party partners at a cost. 2Where can I raise a Service Request for Rain Water Harvesting? Is my addresses servicable? 2Service Requests can be raised on the Utec & Utec Partner Apps. Service is scheduled based on the serviceability of our partners & availability of their experts in your area / location. You will be notified about the serviceability in your location at the time of raising service request on the App. 2Who can request for Rainwater Harvesting System on Utec? 2Home Builders & Partners registered on Utec Platform can request and avail this service 2Is this is a paid service? 2Rain Water Harvesting is a paid service. Payment is to be made directly to our partner assigned for service delivery. No payment is to be done to Utec. 2Is the Rain Water Harvesting system installation dependent on any existing or planned changes to the house? 21. If you are planning to store the rainwater for daily usage, then you need to have an underground concrete tank as collection point.\n2. The slope of the rooftop and the water outlets direction should be towards borewell/Underground water tank so as to reduce the material requirement and hence costs during the final installation 2Which is the preferred process for rainwater harvesting? 2There are two types of processes for Rain Water Harvesting: Filter Process and Soak Pit System. Filter process is recommended for normal roof size(upto 3000 sqft). Soak pit system only for bigger Roof sizes(>3000 sqft) and industrial use 2How much rainwater can I conserve from my roof area? 2Approx 1 lac litre per annum can be harvested with 1000 sq ft roof size with rain fall of 38 inch(~96cm). 2What kind of maintenance would the installed Rain Water Harvesting system require? 2The installed system is nearly maintenance free and durable. It will need only annual cleaning by the local plumber. 2What will be the final cost for Rain Water Harvesting System and who will provide it? 2You will receive the installation & design related inputs along with the final cost of installation on WhatsApp from our Service Delivery Partner in 48 hours after the site visit. 2How much time is required for the installation? 2Post your confirmation and advance payment transfer to our service partner. It will take maximum 7 working days to install the equipment. 2Is there any government waiver or discount offering for Rain Water Harvesting system installation? 2Yes. There are provisions by local state government and Municipal Corporation for a waiver (6% to 20%) in Property Tax or water bill (it applies in some places**)for confirming Rain Water Harvesting System installed with Certified by the installing Party/Vendor. 2Is the Rain Water Harvesting system covered under any warranty by the service delivery partner?
2Rain Water harvesting system installed by our service partner covers 1 year full warranty for any mechanical fault in the system. With 1st year free AMC. ( post it will be chargeable agreed between both parties). Customers should safely store the warranty and AMC documents with them for any future needs. 2What\'s the durability of complete system? 2Entire system can be used at full capacity for up to 20 years if cleaning process is done at advised intervals. 2What are the different types of filters available? 2There are generally 3 types of filters depending on area and water quality\n1) Sand filter: These are constructed by brick masonry and filled by pebbles, gravel, and sand. Each layer is separated by wire mesh.\n2) Charcoal filter: Charcoal filter can be made on site or in a drum. Pebbles, gravel and sand are filled in the drum or chamber. Each layer should be separated by wire mesh. Thin layer of charcoal is used to absorb odour if any.\n3) PVC pipe filter: This filter is made of PVC pipe of 1 to 1.20 m length; Diameter of pipe depends on the area of roof. Six inches dia. pipe is enough for a 1500 Sq. Ft. roof and 8 inches dia. pipe should be used for roofs more than 1500 Sq. Ft. Pipe is divided into three compartments by wire mesh. 2Is it possible to install a Rain Water Harvesting system in a constructed home? 2Yes. Rain Water Harvesting systems need not necessarily be installed in newly built houses. They can also be installed in houses which are already been built. 2Can existing storage structures/unused water sources be used for RWH? 2Instead of constructing recharge structures, existing unused water sources like dried open wells, sumps, defunct borewells, etc can be used for Rain Water Harvesting. 2What happens when the rainwater tank is full? 2Underground and cellar tanks have to be fitted with an overflow through which the water can flow into the sewage system or an infiltration system. If connected to the sewage system, the overflow should be above the system\'s backed-up water level. If necessary, a backpressure flap should be installed. Above-ground tanks should always be connected to a downpipe filter. This will prevent the water from flowing inward when the rainwater tank is full and instead it will flow through the downpipe into the sewer. 2Does the rainwater collected in the rainwater tank remains fresh? 2An underground tank is ideal for storing rainwater because the soil protects the tank from light and heat. Algae and microorganisms cannot form due to exposure to sunlight and temperature, ensuring consistent water quality. If you have an above-ground rainwater tank, you must ensure that it is as opaque as possible (Not transparent or translucent) and it should installed away from direct sunlight, to prevent water from warming. 2What is not covered in the rainwater harvesting service? 2The installation of Underground water tank or borewell would not be done by the service provider under Rainwater Harvesting Service.
2Did you know? 2Pre-construction \ntermite control has \nhigher effectiveness \nthan post-construction \ntreatment 2Pre-construction \ntermite treatment can \nhelp protect not just the \ninterior but also the \nexterior and the \nlandscaping 2Termites can travel \nupwards multiple \nstoreys of the \nconstruction. 2Not just old homes, \neven new homes are \nat risk of termite \ninfestation
2How do I avail the service? 2You can avail of this service by raising a service request in the Anti-Termite Treatment tab on the Utec Platform. 2What will the process be? 2After the request is raised, our executive will call you to confirm the request and to collect additional information, if any. Post this, the details of Service request are passed on to our service delivery partner who will get in touch with you for the service delivery. 2Is there a warranty on the service? 2The Pre-construction termite treatment done at foundation level comes with a warranty of 10 years. For the warranty to be valid, the treatment must be completely administered as per the process suggested by our Service Partner. You can get more information from our termite treatment delivery partner after raising a service request. 2What is termite (white ants, दीमक) ? 2Subterranean Termites are social insects and live in colonies below ground. They are considered pests because termites enter the house structure through a gap (0.5 mm gap is sufficient) in search of food. Food for termites is household material containing cellulose like wood, wooden furniture, paper and cloth. 2How do termites enter the house? 2Termites need moisture to survive and spread underground. They usually enter a house from the soil through its foundation or through cracks in the slab, expansion joints, voids in brick and around plumbing. Wood structures in direct contact with the ground are also easy access routes for termites. 2Can termites enter concrete? 2Termites cannot pass through solid concrete, but they can get through a crack only 1/32nd of an inch wide. Openings this size or bigger often occur where two pieces of concrete abut – like when poured separately – and around plumbing penetrations through the concrete or where the concrete has cracked. 2How they harm the house structure? 2Termites can hollow out the wood in the structure of your house. They can also damage the inside of the walls, areas around your windows and doors and the wood furniture inside your home. 2How to identify termite infestation? 2Signs of termite infestation –\na. Mud tube on wall, ceiling and furniture;\nb. Damaged wooden furniture and fixtures;\nc. Scattered wings of alates / swarmers;\nd. Termite mound in the surrounding of the structure;\ne. Mud shelter on the trunk of the trees, dry patches of grass in lawn, surrounding the structure 2What is Pre-Construction Termite treatment? 2Pre-Construction termite treatment done to prevent termite infestation in new construction. As a part of the treatment, the layer of soil beneath a planned home is treated with termiticide to offer proactive protection. A pre-foundation termite treatment helps in ridding the soil of termites and creating a long term termite barrier for durability of the structure. 2Who can raise the termite treatment request? 2Home Builders & Partners registered on Utec Platform can request and avail this service 2Is this is a paid service? 2Termite Treatment is a paid service. Payment is to be made directly to our partner assigned for service delivery. No payment is to be done to Utec. 2What will the treatment at my site entail? 2Pre Construction: During the plinth level, the soil of the whole plinth level will be treated with the chemicals to create a chemical barrier for the termites.\nPost Construction: To provide the treatment, the service provider will drill 12 mm dia holes about 300 mm apart at skirting level. After the treatment, these holes will be sealed with white cement and we will try to match the colour of the wall to have minimum decor disturbance. 2How does the treatment work? 2The Principle of the treatment is "To create a continuous chemical barrier/zone between the ground and the structure so the ground nesting termites will not attack the structure". 2How many types of termite control treatments are available?
2There are 2 said treatments. Pre construction anti termite treatment - This treatment is ideal for the underconstruction buildings in its early stages. In this the chemical barrier / zone is created in the soil at plinth level and this treatment is called "Pre-construction Anti-termite Treatment". And post construction anti termite treatment when the building structure is ready/existing and infested with termites, this is done by drilling at the wall and floor junction / skirting level and creating the chemical barrier / zone at the bottom of the walls, this treatment is called "Post-construction Anti-termite Treatment". 2For the under construction buildings, does termite treatment cause any disturbance in the process of construction? 2The pre-termite foundation treatment is done simultaneously with your construction work before Plinth PCC (Plain Cement Concrete) and does not affect the process of construction. 2For an existing building, does termite treatment cause any damage to the structure? 2This treatments causes no damage to the structure. To provide the treatment, the service provider will drill 12 mm dia holes about 300 mm apart at skirting level. After the treatment, these holes will be sealed with white cement and we will try to match the colour of the wall to have minimum decor disturbance. 2Do the premises have to be vacated at the time of treatment for existing building (post construction treatment)? 2No. You can also see the treatment done. The only precaution is to wear a face mask & to not touch the chemically treated surfaces. Infants, aged persons or any allergic person should not be present at the time of treatment. Post the treatment, you can stay in the premises immediately after cleaning. 2Is there any warranty for Post Construction termite treatment? 2For the post construction treatment, there is a warranty of 5 years, if done for the entire home / building. In case a specific floor of a building needs to be treated, a 1 year warranty would apply. For the warranty to be valid, the treatment must be completely administered as per the process suggested by our Service Partner. You can get more information from our termite treatment delivery partner after raising a service request. 2How much does termite treatment cost? 2Termite treatment charges can be quoted after the inspection of the site. Charges are dependent on the level of infestation, type of treatment, feasibility of treatment, internal furnitures & fixtures, travel cost and time required for treatment. The service delivery partner will share a detailed estimate of cost post inspection. 2How much time does the treatment take? 2The treatment takes 1 day of time 2Is the site visit paid or free? 2Site Inspection is free, but if the location is far away, then logistics costs may be charged which would get adjusted in the final invoice. 2What is covered in the termite treatment service? 2Sub-terranean termites (ground nesting termites) are only covered in the anti-termite treatment. Since these are the ground nesting termites which grow and travel through the soil, hence the treatment of creating a chemical barrier around the house stops these termites from infesting the house. 2What is not covered in the termite treatment service? 2Dry-wood termites infestation, which are usually experienced in the coastal regions are not covered under the treatment. Since, these termites are wood nesting termites, they grow inside the wood hence the chemical barrier at foundation level doesn\'t affect them. 2For Pre-Construction treatment, do I need to repeat the treatment after the warranty period? 2Once the treatment is done, if the created chemical barrier is disturbed somehow, then we need to re-do the treatment and it will charge extra to the customer. Otherwise, the treatment doesn\'t need to be re-done even after the warranty period is over. 2For post construction treatment, do I need to repeat the treatment after the warranty period? 2After the expiry of the warranty period, customer needs to re-do the post- construction Anti-termite treatment.
